docs.lead_paragraph: The report for June was a sign that a manufacturing slowdown would stretch into the second half of the year. New jobless claims rose last week, but less than expected.

headline.main: U.S. Manufacturing May Be Softening; Factory Orders Fell in June
headline.print_headline: U.S. Manufacturing May Be Softening; Factory Orders Fell in June

docs.abstract: Commerce Department reports new orders for manufactured goods fell 0.5 percent in June, a sign that a manufacturing slowdown will continue into the second half of 2012; Labor Department reports initial claims for state unemployment benefits rose 8,000 in the previous week to a seasonally adjusted 365,000.
docs.snippet: The report for June was a sign that a manufacturing slowdown would stretch into the second half of the year. New jobless claims rose last week, but less than expected.

headline.main: Ad Watch: Obama Campaign Seeks to Recast Romney as Tax Raiser

docs.abstract: "He pays less. You pay more" is the theme of a new Obama campaign ad, which seeks to trumpet the results of a new study of Mitt Romney's tax plan.
docs.snippet: "He pays less. You pay more" is the theme of a new Obama campaign ad, which seeks to trumpet the results of a new study of Mitt Romney's tax plan.

docs.snippet: A collection of links from the reporters and editors of the Dining section.

docs.lead_paragraph: Five years after being told to look at taking Social Security numbers off Medicare cards, Medicare officials say they still need six more months to figure out how much it will cost.

headline.main: Medicare Wants More Time to Study Cost of Security Fix
headline.print_headline: Medicare Wants More Time To Study Cost of Security Fix

docs.abstract: Medicare officials say they will need six additional months to tabulate the costs of taking Social Security numbers off Medicare cards; Government Accountability Office has reported that as many as 48 million people risk having their identity stolen because the numbers remain on the cards.
docs.snippet: Five years after being told to look at taking Social Security numbers off Medicare cards, Medicare officials say they still need six more months to figure out how much it will cost.

docs.lead_paragraph: On a campaign stop in Ohio, President Obama said the new study showed that Mr. Romney’s plans would mean more large tax cuts for millionaires at the expense of other Americans.

headline.main: Obama Says Romney’s Tax Plan Favors Wealthy Only
headline.print_headline: Obama Says Romney’s Tax Plan Favors Wealthy Only

docs.abstract: Pres Obama, appearing in Ohio, assails Mitt Romney's proposed tax overhaul, citing a new study showing that the plan would mean additional large tax cuts for millionaires at the expense of other Americans.
docs.snippet: On a campaign stop in Ohio, President Obama said the new study showed that Mr. Romney’s plans would mean more large tax cuts for millionaires at the expense of other Americans.

headline.main: Obama, in Ohio, Attacks Romney Over Tax Cuts

docs.abstract: President Obama attacked Mitt Romney's proposal to cut taxes for individuals and businesses by more than $5 trillion over the next decade.
docs.snippet: President Obama attacked Mitt Romney's proposal to cut taxes for individuals and businesses by more than $5 trillion over the next decade.

docs.lead_paragraph: Aetna, the big health insurer, also raised its earnings forecast for the full year, and Allstate, the home and auto insurer, returned to profitability.

headline.main: Profit at Aetna and Allstate Tops Analysts’ Expectations
headline.print_headline: Profit at Aetna and Allstate Tops Analysts’ Expectations

docs.abstract: Aetna and Allstate both report earnings that exceed Wall Street expectations; Aetna reports second-quarter net income of $457.6 million, or $1.32 a share, compared with $536.7 million, or $1.39 a share, a year earlier; quarterly revenue rose to $8.82 billion from $8.32 billion a year earlier; Allstate reports a net profit of $423 million, or 86 cents a share, in contrast to a $624 million loss in the same period a year earlier, or $1.19 a share; quarterly revenue rose to $8.28 billion, from $8.08 billion a year earlier.
docs.snippet: Aetna, the big health insurer, also raised its earnings forecast for the full year, and Allstate, the home and auto insurer, returned to profitability.

docs.lead_paragraph: At a time when abortion rights and access to affordable contraception are threatened by political attacks, three federal judges failed to preserve constitutional protections for women.
docs.abstract: Editorial highlights rulings by three federal judges that failed to preserve constitutional protections for women's reproductive rights.
docs.snippet: At a time when abortion rights and access to affordable contraception are threatened by political attacks, three federal judges failed to preserve constitutional protections for women.

docs.lead_paragraph: John Orozco, 19, has one more chance for a medal after he struggled on the pommel horse, then fell on his vault during the men’s team finals. “Oh, I’ll bounce back,” he said.

headline.seo: Bronx Gymnast Puts Rough Day Behind Him
headline.main: Getting Back Up Is Nothing New for Bronx Gymnast
headline.print_headline: Getting Back Up Is Nothing New For Bronx Gymnast

docs.abstract: Olympic gymnast John Orozco, who struggled when the United States finished fifth in the men's team finals, will try once more for a medal in the individual all-around.
docs.snippet: John Orozco, 19, has one more chance for a medal after he struggled on the pommel horse, then fell on his vault during the men’s team finals. “Oh, I’ll bounce back,” he said.
